short_description: In Logistic Regression, a set of independent variables (in this case, columns) is processed to predict the value of a dependent variable (column) that assumes two values referred to as response (1) and non-response (0).
long_description: In Logistic Regression, a set of independent variables (in this case, columns) is processed to predict the value of a dependent variable (column) that assumes two values referred to as response (1) and non-response (0).

argument_clauses.name: Inputcolumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) representing the independent variables used in building a logistic regression model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) representing the independent variables used in building a logistic regression model.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the column that represents the dependent variable being predicted.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the column that represents the dependent variable being predicted.

argument_clauses.name: GroupBycolumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) dividing the input into partitions, one for each combination of values in the group by columns.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name(s) of the column(s) dividing the input into partitions, one for each combination of values in the group by columns.

argument_clauses.name: Stepwise
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to perform a stepwise procedure or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to perform a stepwise procedure or not.

argument_clauses.name: Backward
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to take backward steps or not. Backward steps, i.e., removing variables from a model, use the P-value of the T-statistic, i.e., the ratio of a B-coefficient to its standard error.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to take backward steps or not. Backward steps, i.e., removing variables from a model, use the P-value of the T-statistic, i.e., the ratio of a B-coefficient to its standard error.

argument_clauses.name: BackwardOnly
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use only backward technique or not, i.e. a forward step is not performed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use only backward technique or not, i.e. a forward step is not performed.

argument_clauses.name: Forward
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use forward technique or not. Starting with no independent variables in the model, a forward step is performed, adding the 'best' choice, followed by a backward step, removing the worst choice
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use forward technique or not. Starting with no independent variables in the model, a forward step is performed, adding the 'best' choice, followed by a backward step, removing the worst choice

argument_clauses.name: ForwardOnly
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use only forward technique or not, i.e. a backward step is not performed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use only forward technique or not, i.e. a backward step is not performed.

argument_clauses.name: Constant
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the logistic model includes a constant term or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the logistic model includes a constant term or not.

argument_clauses.name: Convergence
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the convergence criterion such that the algorithm stops iterating when the change in log likelihood function falls below this value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the convergence criterion such that the algorithm stops iterating when the change in log likelihood function falls below this value.

argument_clauses.name: EntranceCriterion
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the criterion to enter a variable into the model. The W-statistic chi-square P-value must be less than this value for a variable to be added.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the criterion to enter a variable into the model. The W-statistic chi-square P-value must be less than this value for a variable to be added.

argument_clauses.name: LiftOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to build a lift chart or not and add it in the functions output string.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to build a lift chart or not and add it in the functions output string.

argument_clauses.name: MatrixData
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the input matrix data to use for the analysis. Instead of internally building a matrix with the Matrix function each time this analysis is performed, the user may build an ESSCP Matrix.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input matrix data to use for the analysis. Instead of internally building a matrix with the Matrix function each time this analysis is performed, the user may build an ESSCP Matrix.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIteration
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum number of attempts to converge on a solution.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum number of attempts to converge on a solution.

argument_clauses.name: MemorySize
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the memory size in megabytes to allocate for in-memory Logistic Regression.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the memory size in megabytes to allocate for in-memory Logistic Regression.

argument_clauses.name: XMLReport
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to produce an XML report showing columns that may be collinear as part of the output or not.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to produce an XML report showing columns that may be collinear as part of the output or not.

argument_clauses.name: RemoveCriterion
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the criterion to remove a variable from the model. The T-Statistic P-value must be greater than this value for a variable to be removed.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the criterion to remove a variable from the model. The T-Statistic P-value must be greater than this value for a variable to be removed.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseValue
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the value assumed by the dependent column that is to be treated as the response value.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the value assumed by the dependent column that is to be treated as the response value.

argument_clauses.name: Sample
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to use sample of the data to be read into memory for processing, if the memory size available is less than the amount of data to process.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to use sample of the data to be read into memory for processing, if the memory size available is less than the amount of data to process.

argument_clauses.name: StatsReport
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether an optional data quality report should be delivered in the function's XML output string or not, which includes the mean and standard deviation of each model variable, derived from an ESSCP matrix.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether an optional data quality report should be delivered in the function's XML output string or not, which includes the mean and standard deviation of each model variable, derived from an ESSCP matrix.

argument_clauses.name: SucessOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether an optional success report should be delivered in the function's XML output string or not, which includes the displaying counts of predicted versus actual values of the dependent variable of the logistic regression model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether an optional success report should be delivered in the function's XML output string or not, which includes the displaying counts of predicted versus actual values of the dependent variable of the logistic regression model.

argument_clauses.name: StartThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the beginning threshold value utilized in the Multi-Threshold Success output.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the beginning threshold value utilized in the Multi-Threshold Success output.

argument_clauses.name: EndThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the ending threshold value utilized in the Multi-Threshold Success output.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the ending threshold value utilized in the Multi-Threshold Success output.

argument_clauses.name: IncrementThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the difference in threshold values between adjacent rows in the Multi-Threshold Success output.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the difference in threshold values between adjacent rows in the Multi-Threshold Success output.

argument_clauses.name: ThresholdOutput
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether the Multi-Threshold Success output should be produced or not and included in the XML output string in the result.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether the Multi-Threshold Success output should be produced or not and included in the XML output string in the result.

argument_clauses.name: ConditionalIndependenceThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the condition index threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the condition index threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.

argument_clauses.name: VarianceProportionThreshold
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the variance proportion threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the variance proportion threshold value to use while generating near dependency report.
